meanings.sent1: She prefunds her vacation by saving money throughout the year.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to prefund the project to ensure its success.
meanings.sent3: John prefunds his weekend plans by putting aside some money every week.
meanings.sent4: Prefunding the event early helped avoid last-minute stress.
meanings.sent5: Prefunding the party made it easier to enjoy without worrying about expenses.

meanings.definition: The act of setting aside money for future expenses.
meanings.sent1: Prefunding is essential for a secure financial future.
meanings.sent2: The prefunding of the emergency fund saved the day during unexpected situations.
meanings.sent3: The prefunding for the school trip made the students excited for the adventure.
meanings.sent4: Her prefunding habits impressed her financial advisor.
meanings.sent5: Prefunding for retirement early can lead to a comfortable life later on.
